Everything’s connected Yeah, other tools exist. But errors , logs , replays , spans , profiles , and metrics — all connected by the same trace? That’s kind of our thing. Go from Issue → Context → Fix. Go from Issue → Context → Fix. Debug 500's, trace slow requests, replay fetch() failures, and fix the broken code that caused it. Catch slow queries, N+1s, and request timeouts before the ‘why is this so slow?’ posts fill up your feed. Map every incident to the release, PR, and owner -- automatically. Debugging needs context— with or without AI Seer , our AI debugger, uses Sentry context – logs, commits, traces, stack trace - so you can stop guessing and it can fix issues for you. Analyzes every signal to explain why your code failed, not just where. Fixes what’s broken while you ship what’s next – generating precise, merge-ready patches. Stops bad code before it starts bad days. Correlating PRs against real error and performance history to catch regressions before they ship. Loved by developers worldwide We wouldn’t have scaled without Sentry. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm a Sales Development Representative at DeepData AI. I came across your company, Factory.ai, and was impressed with the work you're doing in application performance monitoring and error tracking. I'd love to explore how our data processing solution can help you optimize your operations.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (skeptical) Ah, another sales call. What makes you think we need your solution, Alex? We've already got a robust monitoring system in place with Sentry.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand you have a solid foundation with Sentry, but our solution, DeepData AI, can actually complement your existing setup by providing more advanced data processing capabilities. We've helped similar companies like Autodesk and Cloudflare gain deeper insights into their data, leading to significant performance improvements. I'd love to discuss how our solution can specifically address your pain points.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (still skeptical) I'm not convinced. We've invested heavily in our current infrastructure, and I'm not sure I want to add another tool to the mix. What specific benefits can DeepData AI bring to the table that we're not already getting from our existing tools?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about adding new tools. However, our solution is designed to integrate seamlessly with your existing infrastructure, including Sentry. By leveraging machine learning and AI, DeepData AI can help you identify patterns and anomalies in your data that might be missed by traditional monitoring tools. This can lead to faster issue resolution, reduced downtime, and improved overall application performance. We've seen our customers achieve an average reduction of 30% in mean time to resolve (MTTR) issues.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (somewhat intrigued) That sounds interesting, but how do I know it will work for us? We've got a complex tech stack, and I don't want to introduce any new risks or disruptions. Can you share any case studies or success stories from similar companies?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Absolutely. We've worked with companies like GitHub and Duolingo, who have similar tech stacks to yours. In fact, GitHub was able to reduce their error resolution time by 45% after implementing DeepData AI. I'd be happy to share a detailed case study with you and discuss how our solution can be tailored to meet your specific needs. Would you be open to a follow-up conversation to explore this further?
